author: Ravi Reddy
text:
Fireworks go up at the Telangana Bhavan in Hyderabad on Friday after the TRS swept GHMC polls— PhOTO: Nagara Gopal

In a record performance, the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samiti (TRS) unfurled its flag on the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) with a landslide bagging 99 out of the 150 divisions.

The outcome of the election, which shocked not only the Opposition parties but surprised the TRS too, clearly cemented the ruling party’s place in the hearts of the electorate, a mix of people of all parts of the country, particularly those from the neighbouring Andhra Pradesh.

It is after a gap of a decade that one party will have a full term. In the 2004 and 2009 elections, the Congress to approach the MIM for outside support to bag the Mayor and Deputy Mayor’s posts.

If the recent Warangal parliamentary byelection gave a shock to the Opposition parties at the record majority secured by the TRS, the GHMC poll results were no different. The performance in the twin cities and its suburbs proved that TRS has come a long way from a lone corporator in 2004 to over 100 in 2016.

The Congress and TDP-BJP combine’s performance lay in tatters as these parties could not cross the single digit mark.

Majlis-ittehadul-Muslimeen was the second largest party in the GHMC having won 44 seats so far. The TDP-BJP combine settled for five divisions while the Congress won only two divisions.

Elated at the outcome, Chief Minister K. Chandrasekhar Rao drove down Telangana Bhavan, the TRS headquarters where at a press conference overflowing with journalists, he said: “People of Hyderabad from all regions have given a historic mandate to the TRS. Our responsibility towards the welfare and safety of all has increased.”
title: TRS landslide buries Opposition in civic polls
